technologies.title: Front-End Web Development
technologies.description: A front-end web developer is responsible for implementing visual elements that users see and interact with in a web application.

technologies.title: .NET
technologies.description: Programmers produce software by combining their source code with .NET Framework and other libraries. The framework is intended to be used by most new applications created for the Windows platform.

technologies.title: Android Developer.
technologies.description: An Android developer is responsible for the development of applications for mobile devices on Android operating systems.

technologies.title: Full-stack Javascript
technologies.description: Back-End Web Developer Job Description Template. A back-end web developer is responsible for server-side web application logic and integration of the work front-end developers do.

technologies.title: Python
technologies.description: Python is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language. Python has a design philosophy that emphasizes code readability, notably using significant whitespace.

envolved.title: Learn
envolved.description: Are you ready to upgrade your career? Begin your journey with us!

envolved.title: Mentors
envolved.description: Are you a software developer who wants to coach and mentor future developers? Join us!

envolved.title: Be a Part of the Solution!
envolved.description: Looking for junior software talent? Check out our graduates!

faq.question: How much time is needed?
faq.description: At least 15-20 hours of time is required each week working through the online courses, completing coding challenges, and developing your project.

faq.question: Pricing?
faq.description: Code Louisville is offered at no cost to you through a Workforce Innovation Fund grant from the US Department of Labor.

faq.question: What if I am a veteran?
faq.description: Please email us! We offer priority of service to veterans, allowing you to start the program earlier. We will be happy to work with you to get you enrolled as soon as possible. If you are seeking additional resources for veterans, please check out the VCAL Resource Guide

faq.question: Will this help me become a programmer?
faq.description: Yes! Programming is a valuable skill that can be used in every industry. Knowledge of coding can elevate your career or establish a brand new career for you. Code Louisville's goal is to teach you everything you need to be a junior-level developer.

faq.question: Will Code Louisville help me get a job?
faq.description: We will help you learn the skills to get yourself a job! Code Louisville will guide you in learning not only the skills a programmer needs, but also provide you with resume writing and interview workshops, a community of developers to network with, mentors to answer your questions, and more. We also work to get employers interested in the program so they come to us to find their next developer!

faq.question: What certification will I have after completing Code Louisville?
faq.description: We offer open-source software language stacks in our sessions, and there are no well-recognized national industry certifications that will guarantee that you are “certified” as a software developer.
